SENT.plain: Rhabdomyosarcoma (RMS) is the most common pediatric soft tissue sarcoma
Alveolar subtype of RMS is characterized by very poor prognosis and intensive chemotherapy, radiotherapy and surgery often failed
Frequently a secondary malignant neoplasms has been found in patients treated for primary cancer
Ten-years-old boy with RMS in the right thigh after 3 years of treatment revealed therapy related myelodysplastic syndrome and was lost to follow-up 4 months later
